Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Manufacturing Paradigms
headline: Get ahead by exploring the paradigms and ideas that drive the manufacturing industry with this free online course.
description: This free online course helps you to establish yourself in the manufacturing industry. It also suits corporate individuals looking to expand their knowledge and boost their careers. We provide a detailed breakdown of the basic manufacturing processes and philosophies that inform them. Manufacturing is a crucial global industry facing rapid change through new technology and approaches and this course can help you thrive and advance your career.
courseDescription:
This free online course begins by introducing the principles of manufacturing. We explain the primary definitions and goals of manufacturing and identify its various processes with examples. This lets us map each process and link them to the resulting types of product.

We then delve into the ‘manufacturing revolutions’ of the past as we examine some notable inventions from the pre-industrial era and the Industrial Revolution, including the Iron Pillar in Delhi, the Venetian Arsenal and Great Britain’s 32-pounder cannon of 1805. We also take a close look at the distinct eras of manufacturing: mass production, mass customization and mass personalization.

Finally, we study the various ‘laws of manufacturing’, the relevant business models and the applications and impact of ‘technology radar’. The course illustrates how some emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence (AI), augmented reality (AR), machine learning and so on are currently utilized to advance the manufacturing industry. Such knowledge enables you to anticipate change and get ahead of the curve.

Start Course Now

  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.

Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:

  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard.   • Lesson Summary

  • The key points from this module are:
  • Manufacturing is defined as a series of interrelated activities and operations involving the design, materials selection, planning, manufacturing production, quality assurance, management, and marketing of the products of the manufacturing industries.

    Manufacturing is a combination of two Latin words: 'Manus' which means 'Hand', and 'Facio' which means 'To do'.

  • The Goals of Manufacturing are:
    1. The manufacturing process should be quick and timesaving.
    2. The manufacturing process should be cost-effective.
    3. The manufactured products should be of high quality.
    4. The output of the manufacturing process should be diverse.
  • These goals in some cases may be conflicting. A manufacturing company might forgo one or more of these goals in order to achieve another of them.

  • Lesson Summary

  • The key points from this module are:
  • Buffers to Matching Supply and Demand are:
    1. Inventory Buffer
    2. Capacity Buffer
    3. Time Buffer 
  • The Process Parameters include:
    1. Inventory (I) which is the work in progress at a certain time
    2. Throughput (R) which is the rate at which output is made
    3. Cycle time (T) which is the clock time taken in the process
  • Laws of Manufacturing
    1. Little's Law (1961)
    2. Kingman's Law(1961)
